articles.description:
Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images
  

 Many have said it should happen, and probably would have at some point, now it’s practically confirmed - Aaron Mooy is all but set to sign for Celtic. 


Celtic are set to sign Aaron Mooy on free transfer. Full agreement in place, been told contract will be valid until June 2023 with an option to extend for further season. ⚪️  #CelticFC Deal will be completed this week after he left Shanghai. pic.twitter.com/9FqfQpkIrK— Fabrizio Romano (@FabrizioRomano) July 17, 2022



The tap in merchant of confirmed transfers has tweeted it, and we should expect to see Mooy confirmed by the club in the next few days.
We’ll have more of an opinion on Mooy on the podcast as well and discuss it thoroughly rather than shooting at this time on a Sunday night when rational emotions are nowhere to be seen!
We’re sure 67HailHail will have one of the Aussie pundits on to chat about him too.
And speaking of 67HailHail, there was a reaction to the 2-2 draw with Blackburn at the weekend: 

And if you missed the game on Saturday, here’s the highlights:
articles.title: Mooy set for Celtic // Blackburn reaction

articles.description: THERE was a moment in the second-half of Celtic’s draw against Blackburn Rovers that had the entire home support on their feet, as some magic from Jota lit up Celtic Park and reminded everyone just why the fans were so excited when he was finally confirmed on a permanent contract earlier this summer.
articles.title: Sky’s the limit for Jota as Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou and teammate Matt O’Riley wax lyrical about winger

articles.description: MANAGERS will often say that there is little to be taken from friendly games other than the improvement of fitness and match sharpness. But if there is one thing to be deduced from Celtic’s four warm-up encounters to date this summer, it’s that it is unlikely to be a dull season once again under Ange Postecoglou. There were just the four goals this time as they played out a 2-2 draw with English Championship side Blackburn Rovers, first-half strikes from Jota and David Turnbull turning round an early deficit after Sam Gallagher had scored for the visitors in the opening couple of minutes. Ben Brereton-Diaz scored the leveller with 15 minutes left from a free-kick after some slack play from Yosuke Ideguchi, a slightly worrying common theme of Celtic’s games to date. Yes, it’s pre-season of …
articles.title: Attacking verve and defensive sloppiness on show from Celtic once more in draw with Blackburn

articles.description: Unusual slow start It took just 22-seconds for the visitors to take the lead in the match. Some poor mis control in midfield by allowed Blackburn’s attackers to latch onto the ball. A lovely reverse through-ball from Jack Vale slipped in Sam Gallagher. The big striker made no mistake inside the box as he slammed home past Joe Hart. Without doubt, the sloppiness was highly unlike Celtic’s midfield and defensive players. With it being a friendly, of course it doesn’t matter in the grand scheme of things. However, there’s no denying that Postecoglou will not want to a repeat of those mistakes when the league season starts in two weeks. Celtic are always a threat going forward, but it’s also clear at they’re far too open at the back still and are therefore susceptible to losing goals against decent opposition.
articles.title: 3 Celtic things we learned as champions draw with Blackburn

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS left behind some incredible memories for Celtic supporters after his tenure as manager, but he also left behind more than a few memorably far-fetched stories. From encounters with Rangers fans in the Clyde Tunnel to pipping Real Madrid to Charly Musonda, the Irishman had the gift of the gab to go with his undoubted coaching quality.
articles.title: Anthony Ralston laughs off Brendan Rodgers’ Danny McGrain comparison after eclipsing Celtic hero’s goal haul

articles.description: CELTIC are back at home this weekend for the first time since lifting the Premiership title in May.
articles.title: Celtic vs Blackburn Rovers: TV channel, live stream and kick-off time

articles.description: FORFAR ATHLETIC boss Gary Irvine has revealed that Leigh Griffiths won't be joining his side this summer.
articles.title: Ex-Celtic star Leigh Griffiths won't be offered Forfar deal, reveals Gary Irvine

articles.description: Football fans across Scotland have united to tackle the country's food poverty crisis.
articles.title: Football fans across Scotland to hold collection at Celtic park tomorrow

articles.description: GIVEN they have already sanctioned a transfer spend of over £17m in this window, it may be churlish to call on the Celtic board to back Ange Postecoglou with even more cash. But here we are.
articles.title: Celtic need to give Ange Postecoglou final pieces of the jigsaw if he is to solve puzzle of being competitive in Champions League

articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU has moved to ease concerns over former Celtic midfielder Tom Rogic after Australia head coach Graham Arnold expressed his fears over the 29-year-old’s welfare.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou gives assurances over welfare of former Celtic star Tom Rogic: ‘I think Tom’s fine mate’

articles.description: NOT content with pushing Joe Hart out of his comfort zone last season by making him take more responsibility with the ball at his feet, it appeared during Celtic’s pre-season camp in Austria and the Czech Republic that he was attempting to convert the keeper into an auxiliary centre-half.
articles.title: Joe Hart’s high position could be a feature of Celtic’s play says Ange Postecoglou, as manager highlights need for aggression

articles.description: GIORGOS GIAKOUMAKIS jokes that he is still waiting on his trophy to mark his achievement of being the Scottish Premiership’s top scorer last season, but the Celtic striker received an honour that meant a great deal more to him over the summer in any case.
articles.title: Giorgos Giakoumakis chasing more honours for Celtic after top scorer crown leads to emotional recognition from hometown

articles.description: REPORTS have emerged stating that former Celtic star Moussa Dembele has held transfer talks with Manchester United.
articles.title: Ex-Celtic star Moussa Dembele 'holds transfer talks' with Manchester United

articles.description: JOSIP JURANOVIC admits he's flattered to have been linked with a huge move to Atletico Madrid, but he's just desperate to play in the Champions League with Celtic.
articles.title: Celtic star Josip Juranovic addresses transfer speculation amid Atletico Madrid interest

articles.description: LEEDS boss Jesse Marsch has praised Ange Postecoglou and his coaching methods.
articles.title: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou praised by Leeds' Jesse Marsch

articles.description: CELTIC are said to have received a boost in their hopes of landing Fausto Vera this summer.
articles.title: Celtic 'boosted' in bid to sign Fausto Vera as Corinthians pull out of offer

articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU has poured cold water on reports of a move for highly-rated Paris Saint-Germain youngster Edouard Michut, saying that Celtic won’t be looking to bring him to Glasgow this summer.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou plays down reports of Celtic move for Edouard Michut, and discusses Aaron Mooy links

articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU has cleared up any injury fears over Reo Hatate, after the midfielder was missing from the Celtic squad that defeated Banik Ostrava by four goals to two in last night's friendly in the Czech Republic.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou clears up Reo Hatate injury concern after midfielder was missing from Celtic squad

articles.description: LITTLE did anyone associated with Celtic think that the absence of early European qualifiers would provide something of a headache for the squad, but in terms of getting the players up to match speed quickly, replacing them was a conundrum that Ange Postecoglou faced this summer.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou discusses positives and negatives of Celtic pre-season camp, and is pleased by ‘competitive’ friendlies

articles.description: CELTIC manager Ange Postecoglou admits that his team were a little slow out of the traps in their 4-2 pre-season win over Banik Ostrava - but the Greek-Australian was pleased with the players' reaction to falling behind.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou satisfied as Celtic blow away 'pre-season cobwebs' in Banik Ostrava win

articles.description: CELTIC wrapped up their pre-season tour with a 4-2 win over Czech outfit Bank Ostrava.
articles.title: Hart-in-mouth moments and O'Riley runs the show: Talking points from Celtic's friendly win

articles.description: CELTIC crashed Banik Ostrava’s party to round off their pre-season training camp in style, as goals from Kyogo, Matt O’Riley, Giorgos Giakoumakis and Liel Abada gave them a deserved win in the Czech Republic.
articles.title: Celtic crash the party to bring curtain down on pre-season camp in style
